See also: {stefanboltsemasi} ($sigma_{SB}$), {plankexu}, {tcelerita}, {gravnutnoia}, {avgadro}, {ocnerta}, {nejni}, {kelvo}, {nilgla}.

rows.d: unary mekso operator: immediately convert number into a single digit.
immediately convert symbolic string to number (explicit)
mekso operator/function terminator (in Polish notation): inserts exactly enough "{boi}"'s consecutively so as to terminate the most recently uttered operator/function in a mekso expression
rows.n: Encloses the operator and all of its explicitly mentioned operands within a pair of mekso parenthesis ({vei} and {ve'o} respectively).  All operand slots that have not already been explicitly filled are now (implicitly) filled by the default operand, {xo'ei} (which itself is taken to behave in its default mode), or the identity element under that operator/function in that position/role (in the sense that 0 or 1 is identity under exponentiation as the position/role of being the base but only 1 is identity for exponentiation in the exponent position/role).  Operators of arbitrary arity (such as {su'i}) are terminated immediately after the most recently explicitly mentioned operand. If the character string/digraph "eu" (and a corresponding diphthong) ever becomes valid in Lojban, .krtisfranks. asks that the meaning of this word be transferred wholly intact to "{boi'eu}" and that then this word be(come) unassigned.

rows.d: preserve formal interpretation of mekso subexpression with no substitutions made
rows.n: In a sense, "converts" an expression from one that has been tampered with in any way to exactly what was uttered in the first place. See: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/Proposal:_distinguishing_digits_from_numbers#Avoiding_the_.22.22D.22_Equals_.229.22.22_hole

rows.d: explicit "mu'o'u"-orientation marker
rows.n: Must be adjacent to at least one "{mu'o'u}". It 'walls off' that "mu'o'u" from applying to a quotation on the other side of this word; by the nature of "mu'o'u", this word should be elidable when two "mu'o'u"s are mutually adjacent (if this word were to be absent) or when there is no more than one quotation which is adjacent to the "mu'o'u" in question (if this word were to be absent), or when there is no "mu'o'u"; it is mandatory when it is not elidable. Example: in "lu X li'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", it is not clear which quote (and, more specifically, which end of which quote) is being modified by "mu'o'u" - in this case, "boi'o'u" is mandatory; in "lu X li'u boi'o'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with Y; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u boi'o'u  lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u (boi'o'u) mu'o'u  lu Y li'u", the first "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X, the second to the quote with Y, and this word is not necessary (marked via parenthesis).

rows.n: {bridi}, {selbri} and elements of {terbri} are referents of {brisni}, {selbrisni} and elements of {terbrisni} respectively.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a subsentence of Lojban grammar.
rows.n: A subsentence of the official Lojban grammar is put in NU-clause, NOI-clause or gek-gik-clause. The form is similar to a sentence of Lojban grammar, but subsentences cannot be connected to each other by afterthought connectives. See also {brisni} and {simsa}.

rows.d: $x_1$ induces from their auditive perception that $x_2$ is the case.
$v_1$ is a morphologically defined predicate word signifying relation $b_2$ in language $v_3$.
rows.n: Derived from {bridi} and {valsi}, deleting $b_3$, as we are speaking of the relationship independent of particular arguments.  In Lojban, such words must end in a vowel and contain a consonant cluster within the first five letters (not counting y).  Not all words that can be used as a selbri (for instance members of GOhA) are brivla.

rows.d: $c_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ that morphologically [strict] is brivla $bv_1$ in language $x_5$
rows.n: The name must strictly be a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x5); as such, in Lojban, the word(s) c1 must end with vowels and in fact must exactly follow the morphology of brivla. See also: {brivlasmicme} (a specialization); {jvocme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x5 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

rows.d: $x_1$=$c_1$=$s_1$ (quoted word(s)) is a name of $x_2$=$c_2$ used by $x_3$=$c_3$ that morphologically [loose] evokes/is similar to/is a brivla $x_4$=$v_1$=$s_2$ (text; may be multiple words), similar in property/quality[/amount?] $x_5$=$s_3$ (ka/ni), in language $x_6$
rows.n: s3 will likely just be morphological structure. Strict brivlacme are a subclass of brivlasmicme.  The name must "look like" a (sequence of) brivla (according to rules for language x6), but need not exactly follow the morphological requirements thereof (in particular, c1 may end with a consonant in Lojban). See also: {brivlacme} (a specialization); {jvosmicme} (a different specialization that is analogous but restricted to Lojbanic lujvo).  Language is specified to be x6 rather than bv_n because the definition for {brivla} has not yet gained consensus and this particular terbri is dependent thereupon.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a brivla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
rows.n: {brivo} + {cmene}; see {brivla}. Syn. {brivlacme}. List of common brivycme: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/brivycme

rows.d: $x_1$ is a mass-individual (myopic singular, Mr Broda); $x_1$, or rather every individual among $x_1$, is logically an individual but represents a plurality and has the properties of what it represents

rows.n: This term is specific to Lojban. A ‚Äúbu letteral‚Äù is defined as one word which has been made to a letteral with ‚Äú{bu}‚Äù. $x_1$ is a quote (eg. with {lu}‚Ä¶{li'u}) containing the ‚Äúbu letteral‚Äù (including ‚Äúbu‚Äù), $x_2$ quotes the character which the ‚Äúbu letteral‚Äù stands for verbatim, which requires to use a {zoi} quote. See also: {lerfu}.

rows.n: Additional -'a syllables may be added as desired. See {u'i}, {le'o}, {xa'a}, {cmila}, {palci}

rows.d: abstractor: abstractor to create logically quantified selbri variable to be used in predicate logic of third or higher order.
rows.n: {zo'e} and {da} are a constant and a bound variable of predicate logic of first order respectively; {co'e} and {bu'a} are a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable of predicate logic of second order respectively; in order to express predicate logic of third or higher order, it is essential to have selbri that treat selbri variables in the domain of all selbri of second order. {su'u} and {bu'ai} in selma'o NU can compose respectively a selbri constant and a bound selbri variable in the domain of all selbri of second order. In the case that {bu'ai} takes plural number of selbri variables, connect them with {ju'e} or something. Higher order is also possible by nesting {bu'ai}. Example: su'o bu'ai xe'u kei su'o bu'a ro da zo'u bu'ai da bu'a (This {xe'u} is an abstraction-variable-indicator-{selbrisle} used in order to put a word of selma'o NU in prenex.) See also {su'u}, {bu'a}; {xe'u}.

rows.d: Buenos Aires.

attitudinal contour:

rows.n: Inner structure of the rule: BY | any-word BU | LAU lerfu-word | TEI lerfu-string FOI. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

elliptical/unspecified/vague letteral/symbol
rows.n: Has use in mekso at the least; in this context, it might subsume {xo'e} (but see: {xo'e'o'e}). It also may be useful in spelling, initialisms, etc. If used as a pro-sumti (as other letters are), it means {zo'e} but only for reasonable or previously specified letterals assignments.

rows.n: A way to shock people analogous to yelling "BOO!" at someone.

rows.d:
attitudinal contour: 
{bu'o} - start emotion

{bu'onai} - end emotion.
$x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
rows.n: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).
rows.n: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically).  (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, {pilno})

rows.n: The gismu {burna} refers to objects which are brown, but not the color brown itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}. EDIT: That should actually say "{bunre}", but I typed in "{burna}" because I'm an idiot.  I didn't correct it in making this edit because the irony is magnificent.

$x_1$ watches the event $x_2$ unfold before their very eyes/live/red-handed/in flagrante (delicto), using senses/means $x_3$.
rows.n: No implication of the action being considered improper or discouraged. The event must be an action (lo nu {zukte}), not just an occurrence. "Before one's very eyes" is an idiomatic expression and does not require sight to have been involved, nor $x_1$ to even have eyes.

rows.n: {cabycte} is tonight, whether or not it is currently night yet. {bavlamcte} is tomorrow night, even if {cabycte} is still in the future. See also {nicte}, {bavlamcte}, {prulamcte}, {cabdei}.

rows.d: $c_1$=$f_1$ is live (experienced as it happens) to experiencer $c_2$.
$k_1$=$c_1$ ranges through time/has duration $k_2$=$c_2$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is the complete duration as the amount of time or an interval specification and is non-aorist. Cf. {temci}.

rows.n: This is similar to {ritli}, but the emphasis is not necessarily on particular rituals, but customs (ex. wearing of a particular type of clothing or hairstyle) associated with a group.

If the world were proper/correct/just/ruled perfectly and strictly according to $x_3$ and if $x_2$ were true, then $x_1$ would be true as well.
rows.n: Moral judgment goes in $x_3$. $x_3$ can also be assumed by expectation under hypothesized laws of physics, by the true situation of the world, etc. Synonymous with {zgadi}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a wound on body $x_2$ at locus $x_3$ caused by $x_4$
rows.n: Unlike velxai, it's specific to physical injuries pertaining to the surface of an organic body such as skin. Open wounds include ka'arcagna for "incision / incised wound", fercagna for "laceration", gukcagna for "abrasion", tuncagna for "puncture wound", grecagna for "penetration wound", batcagna for "bite wound", dancagna for "gunshot wound", jelcagna for "burn", da'ercagna for "bedsore", furcagna for "necrosis"; closed wounds include daxcagna for "contusion/bruise", camdaxcagna for "hematoma", ra'ircagna for "chronic wound".

Evidential: "because I say so"/"because I assert it to be true"/"it is known".
rows.n: Maybe also "because I am your parent" in some contexts. The claim is true not because the utterer defines it to be so/has the authority or ability to make it so, but instead simply because they claim it to be true. Useful for dealing with annoying children who ask "why" iteratively; not useful for actually convincing anyone of the claim.

rows.d: Unary mekso operator: unit vector/normalization of the argument (vector) X.
rows.n: Outputs X/|X|, where X is the vector-valued input; this is the unit vector which points in the direction of X. It might generalize to other tensors and the like. The definition of the magnitude/norm/metric is left to context or the explicit definition of the space in which X lives.

rows.d: evidential: I don't define

rows.n: Denote $x_1$ by "‚ô§"; for any elements x,y in the set of concern, if '‚ô§' is commutative, then x‚ô§y = y‚ô§x, where equality is defined in the space. "Commutative property"/"commutativity" = "ka(m)( )cajni". See also: {socni}, {sezni}, {dukni}, {facni}.

number: uncountably infinite of some sort or infinite in the sense of satisfying the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.
rows.n: An infinite cardinality which is not countable (aleph-0); if the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis (GCH) is rejected, meaning that the only infinite cardinalities are those of aleph-n form (for nonnegative integer n), then this word would incorporate all uncountable infinities (aleph-m for any strictly positive integer m); else, it incorporates those and any infinity which is strictly larger than aleph-0.

rows.d: Digit string: aleph-nought, aleph-0, the cardinality of the natural (alternatively: integer) numbers
tense interval modifier: countably infinitely many times; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
rows.n: Not necessarily discrete or unbounded in time, nor (eventually or otherwise) infinitely frequent; as a set of Lebesgue measure 0, it is definitely not "always" ({roroi}) in most contexts. For a less specific form of "infinitely many times", use "{ci'iroi}". For the R type of uncountably infinitely many times, use "{ci'iparoi}".

rows.d: transfinite ordinal little-omega; if followed by a number, it denotes the ordinal which is little-omega subscripted therewith in English notation
transfinite ordinal little-epsilon; if followed by a number, in English notation, the following number would be denoted by a subscript
tense interval modifier: continuum (R) type infinitely many time(s); objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
rows.n: Strictly more times than "{ci'inoroi}" but not necessarily equivalent to "{roroi}" (for example, this word's reference set of times includes bounded intervals (not treated as "{paroi}"/single discrete events) and intervals with gaps). More specific than "{ci'iroi}".

rows.d: tense interval modifier: occurs infinite times, eternally; objective tense; defaults as time.

$x_1$ [loves/takes great, passionate interest in] $x_2$
rows.n: e.g. he *loves* football, I *love* Lojban. From {cinri} + {prami}. See {entuzi}

rows.d: $c_1$=$z_1$ is more interesting than $z_2$ to $c_2$ in amount $z_4$.
$g_1$ ties $j_1$ to $j_2$ with $c_1$.
$c_1$ is the wet season of year/years $c_3$.

$t_1$=$c_1$ is an eternity.

rows.d: name: Chicago
number/quantity: 3,000 expressed with comma.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is awake/alert/conscious.

rows.n: A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of $x_2$, hence $x_3$.  See also {cfila}, {spofu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) explains $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) to $x_{3}$ with explanation $x_{4}$ (du'u).
rows.n: Explanation $x_4$ is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for $x_2$ (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause.  See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

rows.d: $s_1$=$c_1$ daydreams about $s_2$; $s_2$ is a daydream of $s_1$=$c_1$.

$x1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains asbestos

$x_{1}$ is a cloud with cloud material-moisture $x_{2}$ with cloudy $x_{3}$ with cloud base [elevation] $x_{4}$.
$l_1$ is an implicitly metaphorical lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor $l_4$.
rows.n: Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for ‚Äú{pe'a}‚Äù). The word ‚Äú{cimjvo}‚Äù is itself an example of cimjvo. Synonym of ‚Äúcimjvo‚Äù with explicit metaphor: ‚Äú{pevycimjvo}‚Äù.

rows.d: God.
propane

metadata tag / hashtag
rows.n: Hashtags are very common in written Lojban conversations. This cmavo makes them pronouncable, thereby opening them up for verbal communication.

rows.d: discursive: marks an utterance as using something that is experimental/not official, especially experimental grammar
rows.n: In some sense, functions as an error marker or an error quote (but without the quote).

rows.d: unary mex operator: n-set; maps a nonnegative integer 'a' to the set $\{1, \dots ,a\}$ (the intersection of the set of all natural numbers with the closed ordered interval [1,a] such that $a$ geq $1$).
rows.n: 0 maps to the empty set. Inputting infinity produces the set of all natural numbers, N.

rows.d: mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.
rows.n: Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega)  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.

rows.n: 'stage 3 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla'

rows.d: mekso 4-nary operator: spherical harmonics on colatitudinal/polar angle $a$ and azimuthal/longitudinal angle $b$ of unassociated order $c$ and associated order $d$.
rows.n: Usually denoted $Y^m_l (\theta, \phi)$. The Condon-Shortley phase must be prepended to the definition. The normalization is chosen so that the integral over all (solid) angles of $Y^m_l(\Omega) conj(Y^n_k(\Omega))  = \delta(m,n) \delta(l,k)$.

rows.n: For example, {re} {ca'oi} {pai} is ‚àí2, and {pa} {ca'oi} {vei} {pai}{fe'i}{vo} is about 0.7071 + 0.7071i.

rows.d: space (character)

rows.n: Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi).  See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a chart/diagram/map of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is an idea/concept/thought that is potentially harmful to $c_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
rows.n: The being put in jeopardy by the concept is not necessarily the thinker of the concept. For example, the concept of a certain type of terrorist act is not (only) dangerous to the would-be terrorist. 'Thought hazard' has a broader meaning than 'informational hazard' and 'knowledge hazard' ({capselju'o}, {junckape}, {capfatci} or {facyckape} ‚Äì closely related words), which have to do with dangerous ideas that are true. [See Bostrom (2011).] Synonymous with {sibyckape}, which some may prefer.

rows.d: $s_1$ (agent) threatens/menaces idea/action $s_2$ to audience $s_3$.
time tense: is going to, is now just about to, is now anticipating; (tense/modal).

rows.n: Also revolve (= {jincarna}).  See also {gunro}, {jendu}. New definition of {carna} originally proposed by Robin Lee Powell and backward-compatible with the old one. Official definition: $x_1$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_2$ in direction $x_3$.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ rains/showers/[precipitates] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].

rows.n: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe".  See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons $x_{2}$ derived on basis $x_{3}$.

rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$).  See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.

rows.n: ($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change.  (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.

$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, {posyselcerda} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jgina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.

{claxu} modal, 1st place                            lacked by ...

links terms into an afterthought termset.
digit/number: % percentage symbol, hundredths.

non-logical connective: ordered sequence link; "and then", forming a sequence.
$x_1$ is a group of people who love each other in a sexual or non-sexual way, which includes the individuals $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$, $x_5$, etc., etc., etc.
rows.n: The most common {celdi} is a couple, but the word also covers polyamorous collectives, polygyny, polyandry, etc. Could even cover {lanzu}. Proposed rafsi is -cle-.

Degrees of freedom should be descriptive (not just a number which counts how many there are); so, $x_4$ would be a list of possible moves available.

$x_1$=$n_1$ is a firefight/gunfight/gun-battle/duel between combatants $x_2$=$d_1$ and $x_3$=$d_2$ over issue $x_4$=$d_3$ (abstract).
rows.n: {celxacnunda'a} is synonymous. For the classic pistol duel once common in Europe and the Americas, see {celkemvilnunjivna}/{celxackemvilnunjivna}.

rows.d: $xa_1$=$c_1$ is a gun/cannon/firearm for use against $xa_2$ by $xa_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
rows.n: jvajvo; Gismu deep structure is "cecla gi'e xarci".

rows.d: $x_1$ is the society / community system of $x_2$ (society members, exhaustive)
$s_1$ is the science of community systems/ societies based on methodology $s_2$
rows.n: $s_1$ refers to sociology in the sense of the study of societies. For the study of social behavior see {jikske}. See also {cemci'e}, {saske}.

rows.d: $l_1$=$c_1$ is a tribe with members including $l_1$ according standard $l_3$.
$s1$ pertains to community $s2$=$c2$
rows.n: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for communities: From gismu {cecmu} and {srana}

rows.d: $x_1$ is $x_2$ percent of $x_3$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$.
$l1$=$c1$ is $l2$ centiliter(s)/centilitre(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $l3$
$d1$ is $d2$ full (centi)milidays (hundred-thousandth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 (centi)miliday) by standard $d3$; d1 is a metric second.
rows.n: For use with metric time system. (It is not proper in the standard metric system to combine prefixes, but lojban's grouping rules allow for it.)

rows.d: $m_1$=$c_1$ is $m_2$=$c_2$ centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$=$c_3$ by standard $x_4$=$m_3$.
$d_1$ is $d_2$ full centidays (hundredth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 centiday) by standard $d_3$
rows.n: For use with metric time system.

rows.d: $m_1$=$c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2$=$c_2$ at location $m_3$=$c_3$.
$ca_1$ is matutinal/active during the pre-dawn/early morning $ce_1$=$m_1$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a breakfast composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$r_1$ blesses/sanctifies $c_1$ in the name of person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.
$u_1$ is a slider in user interface $u_2$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a font interrelated by rules or relations $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (full set) displaying $x_{4}$ (property of $x_{1}$).
$x_1$ (li; tensor with units of $kg*m^2$) is the moment of inertia/angular inertial-mass/rotational inertia of object $x_2$ around axis/point of reference $x_3$ in basis/coordinate system $x_4$.
rows.n: Physics is all about expressing the same thing in different ways in order to gain new insight about it. There are other ways to express a mathematical quantity which is equivalent to this one (much as gravitational charge and inertial mass are mathematically mutually equal but not conceptually identical).

rows.d: $x_1$ is official, approved by $x_2$, an authority over $x_3$
$x_1$ is a voiceless postalveolar sibilant fricative sound produced by $x_2$.
rows.n: Derived from and synonymous with {cy zei sance}. The odd morphological form serves to place the most salient consonant in the stressed syllable.

rows.d: $x1$ pertains to Ch√¢telperronian technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$
$j_1$ is the bishop/archbishop of $j_2$ of religion $l_1$.
$x1$ pertains to/reflects Seanchan culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x2$
$x_1$ has ADHD, satisfying symptom(s) $x_2$ (ka).
$x_1$ is a quantity of shawarma containing $x_2$
$x_1$ is a game of chess between $x_2$ (white) and $x_3$ (black).
I declare that the symbol/expression $x_1$ (quote) henceforth has predicate $x_2$ as its meaning.
$x_1$ is a polo shirt of material $x_2$.
rows.n: A T-shaped shirt with a collar, typically a two- or three-button placket, and an optional pocket. Cf. {creka}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a T-shirt made from material $x_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ shekels/tolas in mass by standard $x_3$
rows.n: Both are about 11.7 g (the shekel being more variable), and both are derived from a word meaning "weigh".

rows.d: $x_1$ (knowledge) is science about subject matter $x_2$ based on the Scientific Method $x_3$
rows.n: Specific to the Scientific Method. Cf. {saske}.

rows.d: members of $x_1$ (ordered set with two members) are related to each other as members of $x_2$ (ordered set with two members) or as members of $x_3$ (ordered set with two members) ... (infinite number of places)
$x_1$ is a/the kidney [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is a cornflower of type $x_2$
$x_1$ is in the center of $x_2$
rows.n: A central subset (of a set or territory). Use {midju} for center point, {kernelo} for nucleus.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a centrifuge/centrifugal machine
$x_1$ is a hornet/yellowjacket of genus/species $x_2$
Rot-13.
Checkmate.
Shahnameh
rows.n: The Persian epic poem written by Ferdowsi ({la} {ferdoSIS}).

rows.d: $x_1$ is Sagittarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
rows.n: From shooter (={celgunta}). The Babylonians identified Sagittarius as the god Pabilsaƒù, a strange centaur-like creature firing an arrow from a bow.The sumerian name may be translated as the 'Forefather' or 'Chief Ancestor' (=barda dzena?). In Greek mythology, Sagittarius is identified as a centaur: half human, half horse.

rows.d: Sheol
elliptical/unspecified truth value; "maybe, maybe not"
rows.n: {cau'i}, but in NA. Indicates unspecificity or uncertainty between {ja'a} and {na}. See {cau'e}.

rows.d: elliptical/unspecified scalar modifier: "maybe, maybe not", modifies next selbri-unit or tag
rows.n: {cau'i}, but in NAhE. Shortened from {cau'o'e}. See {cau'a}.

rows.d: modifier / discursive: elliptical affirmative; "maybe, maybe not"
rows.n: Elliptical NAI/CAI. "Maybe yes, maybe no, maybe somewhere in between". Can also modify attitudinals: {uicau'i} = "Maybe I'm happy, maybe I'm sad". See {ju'ocu'i}, {ju'acu'i}, {ju'oinai}, {cau'a}, {cau'e}, {na'i}, {ge'e}

rows.d: elliptical/vague/indecisive scalar affirmer/negator; true neutral/non-committed/uninvolved scalar truthfulness/assertion
rows.n: Useful for when the truthfulness or falseness of a bridi is undesirable (the speaker makes no firm stance or assumption on the matter). Different from {no'e} in that it does not necessarily select a neutral value on a scale; it merely acknowledges that some value on the scale could be chosen/that the scale exists, but does not choose one (it is hands-off). If one does not want to accuse someone of being or doing something, but wants to talk about it, this word would be used; often can be used for "are or are not".

rows.d: right now
rows.n: Narrows the scope/meaning of "now" to be relatively more immediate (but it still may encompass a small interval that extends into the objective/physical past and/or future).

rows.d: nowadays, wide sense of "now"
rows.n: The interval that is considered to be "now" by the speaker is relatively large(r).

rows.d: Shane
lambda variable prenex; marks the end of introduction of lambda-scope variables.
rows.n: Cf. {zo'u}. In effect this word is used as a shortcut around verbose repeated assignment in a {ka} prenex: lo ka ce'u goi ko'a ce'u goi ko'e ... zo'u ... is the same as lo ka ko'a ko'e ... ce'ai ... In either form this style can be used to avoid subscripting and to disambiguate nested {ka}, {ni}, etc.

rows.d: Formulates periodic ordered list of exactly the connectands in the order presented.
rows.n: Links together conmectands in a single list until connectives end or get interrupted (say, by a higher-precedent different connective); so "x1 ce'au x2 ce'au x3" produces a single ordered list of period three of form "x1, x2, x3, x1, x2, x3, x1, ... [etc.]". If the list has a natural or known definitive initial state/element (but no such terminating one), then it is the first element which is mentioned; likewise, if the list has a natural or known definitive terminating state/element (but no such initial one), then it is the last item/connectand explicitly mentioned and linked by this word into the same list; both of these are semi-infinite cases. Finite cases have no pressuposed beginning or end state/item. This word is agnostic on whether the list is finite (only finitely many repetitions naturally/are known to occur; arbitrarily many periods/cycles or otherwise), semi-infinite (infinitely many repetitions occur, but there is a definitive start or end state which is natural or known to occur; it is also agnostic, in this case, about which of these options is the applicable one), or doubly-infinite (extends in both directions infinitely; infinitely many cycles, no definitive beginning or end). If exactly two items are linked into the list in total, then the list is 2-periodic: it alternates between the two items (back-and-forth); examples of this would be "on and off" (describing, say, a flickering light), "right, left, right, left, ..." (describing walking), etc. Having exactly three items in the list will produce a list which is 3-periodic and 'rotates' through the items cyclically in order; an example of this would be a description of traffic light signals ("green, yellow, red, green, yellow, red, green, ..."); it does not oscillate/swing back and forth between the explicit 'period endpoints' (so, NOT "green, yellow, red, yellow, green, yellow, red, yellow, green, ..."). See also: {je}, {ce}, {fa'u}.

rows.d: BIhI argument modifier: indicates dimensionality/length of tuple
rows.n: Followed immediately by a nonnegative integer n (which is no less than the length of the nearby argument) without "li" prefacing it; otherwise, it is terminated and the (implicit/elided) number assumed is {za'u} {pa}. The argument is understood to be a point/formal tuple in a space of at least the 'dimensionality' described by n. Its exact behavior depends on context (for example: being next to a formal tuple versus next to a point in, say, a geometric space).  See: https://mw.lojban.org/index.php?title=Extended_Dimensionality_of_Interval_cmavo

rows.d: $x_1$ is the year / era of years indicated by PA (digit string) in calendar system $x_2$
rows.n: In the PA string, use PA4 digits as blanks to refer to time ranges. For example: "lo pasobixo'e cei'a" is the eighties (198X years), "lo pamuso'ixo'e cei'a" is the late 16th century (high 15XX years). x1 is an event or concept.

rows.d: define following selbri with sentence or tu'e...tu'u clause
rows.n: Usage: The selbri after {cei'e} is defined by the associated sentence or {tu'e}...{tu'u} clause. {bo'a}, {bo'e}, {bo'i}, {bo'o}, and {bo'u} represent places $x_1$ through $x_5$ within its place structure. (Use {bo'ai} for more places if needed, or {ce'u} for "next place"). // {cei'e} is meant to be used to define new words (implicit {ca'e}) but may be modified by evidentials to express an assertion ({ju'a}) or opinion ({pe'i}) on a meaning instead. Alternatively, {smuni} and {ka'ei} may be used. // See {cei}, {goi}, {goi'e}

rows.d: pro-bridi: the universal predicate
rows.n: True for all values. See also: {zai'o} (pro-sumti; empty), {gai'o} (pro-bridi; empty), {mai'i} (pro-sumti; universal), {ctaipe}.

rows.d: extracts an element from a set, category, class, group, collection, organization, system, etc.
rows.n: The following word should be a set, category, or class; the result is some element which belongs thereto. Approximately equivalent to "lo cmima be [following sumti]".

rows.d: argument list separator: acts as a comma between arguments in an argument list supplied to a function.
rows.n: "ce'oi" is the word of choice to separate the arguments in $bridi_3$. Using {ce'o} there has obvious limitations when the selbri actually calls for a sequence. Obviously, ce'oi has issues too if the selbri can accept an argument list, but this can be circumvented more readily with {ke}...{ke'e} brackets than it can with {ce'o}. Consider ".i lo ka broda cu selbri fi ko'a ce'o ko'e". Without inspecting the type requirements of {broda} and the respective types of {ko'a} and {ko'e}, one cannot determine the meaning of the {bridi}. Furthermore, if one accepts non-static typing of {sumti} places, multiple correct answers can be given for a question asking what is the $bridi_1$. This would create ambiguity that is otherwise resolved by "ce'oi". See also {ka}, {du'u}, {me'au}

rows.d: attitudinal-indicator-to-selbri conversion: $x_1$ feels the indicated emotion toward/about $x_2$.
rows.n: The inverse of {ki'ai}. The $x_2$ place is defined as the thing to which x1 would apply the attitudinal indicator to when using the attitudinal to express the feeling: {mi} ci'au {iu} {do} communicates much the same thing as using {do} {iu} in a bridi. See also {cinmo} and the {uinmo} series of zi'evla: {uinmo}, {u'inmo}, {uanmo}, etc.

rows.d: mensonge at-most-3-ary operator: integer lattice ball; the set of all points belonging to the intersection of $Z^n$ with the closure of the ball that is centered on $X_1$ and has radius $X_2$ in metric $X_3$, where $Z$ is the set of all integers and where, for any set $A$ and non-negative integer $n$,  $A^n$ is the set of all $n$-tuples such that each coordinate/entry/term belongs to $A$
rows.n: $X_3$ defaults to whatsoever metric is specified to apply but which is outside of this function; contextless default is discrete, taxicab, Euclidean, Chebyshev maximum norm; for explicit specification, use "{mau'au}"-"{zai'ai}" quotation. $X_2$ defaults to $1$. $X_1$ defaults to $0 = (0,...,0)$, id est the origin. See also: {mi'i}, {ci'au'u}.

rows.d: elidable terminator: end conversion of attitudinal indicator to selbri; elidable except before further attitudinals.

attitudinal: 
{ci'au'u'au'i} - pride about having just invented a new attitudinal
{ci'au'u'au'inai} - shame about having just invented a new attitudinal
$x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.
quantifier selbri: convert 3 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the trio of members $x_{2}$.
quantified selbri: convert 3 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is third among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kisses/busses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wrinkle/crease/fold [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an insect/arthropod of species $x_{2}$; [bug/beetle].
$x_{1}$ is thin in direction/dimension $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; [relatively short in smallest dimension].
$x_{1}$ feels emotion $x_{2}$ (ka) about $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also mood/humor (= {nuncni}).  See also cmavo list {ci'o}, {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {manci}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (abstraction) interests/is interesting to $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is interested in $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Use $x_1$ tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}).  See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ in activity/state $x_{2}$ exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ courts/flirts; $x_3$ could be a ka[gender or role], ka[attraction to a gender], or ka[type of activity], etc.; (adjective:) $x_1$ is sexual/sexy; $x_1$ is flirted with/courted by $x_2$ (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). Cf. {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance $x_{2}$, in a base of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for $x_{2}$ to pinch $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bird/avian/fowl of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state $x_{2}$ in subject $x_{3}$ (individ./set/mass).
rows.n: Also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in $x_3$ must be completely specified).  See also {ciksi}, {troci}, {jarco}, {pajni}, {saske}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ loses person/thing $x_{2}$ at/near $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ loses property/feature $x_{2}$ in conditions/situation $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {po'ecri}, {posyselcri} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {facki}, {ralte}, {sisku}, {claxu}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {binra}, {mipri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ inscribes/writes $x_{2}$ on display/storage medium $x_{3}$ with writing implement $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a scribe.
rows.n: Also $x_3$ writing surface.  See also {papri}, {penbi}, {pinsi}, {tcidu}, {xatra}, {pixra}, {prina}, {finti} for 'author' or specific authorial works, {barna}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ smiles/grins (facial expression).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a system interrelated by structure $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (set) displaying $x_{4}$ (ka).
rows.n: $x_1$ (or $x_3$) is synergistic in $x_4$; also network; $x_2$ also relations, rules; $x_3$ also elements (set completely specified); $x_4$ systemic functions/properties. See also cmavo list {ci'e}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {stura}, {tadji}, {munje}, {farvi}, {ganzu}, {judri}, {julne}, {klesi}, {morna}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is junior.  See also {laldo}, {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a history of $x_{2}$ according to $x_{3}$ (person)/from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property $x_{2}$, of year(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by $x_2$, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by $x_3$ (default every year); ($x_2$ and/or $x_3$ may need metaphorical restriction: {djecitsi}, {pavdeicitsi}; also equinox, solstice, time of year.  See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$, parasitic on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic.  See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= {selkai}).  See also: cmavo list {kai}, {ka}; {tcaci}, {tcini}. Need not be a defining property (which is what "characterize" means in English).

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$.  See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (event/property).
$x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audience/community $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain $x_{2}$ with cones $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is loud/noisy at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is without/lacking/free of/lacks $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$-less.
$x_{1}$ is a moss/lichen of species/strain $x_{2}$ growing on $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is mossy.
$x_{1}$ (event) is early by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is polite/courteous/civil in matter $x_{2}$ according to standard/custom $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$.  See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a loop/circuit of $x_{2}$ [material].
rows.n: Also noose (= {skoclupa}, {saljgeclupa}; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}).  See also {djine}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}).  See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
rows.n: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
rows.n: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}).  See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor).  (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
rows.n: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
rows.n: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a copy/manifestation/container (a physical object or its analogue) of a literary work [$x_2$], not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri}). See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
rows.n: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
rows.n: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$.  See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition.  See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion.  See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by calendar $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (time units in $x_1$ are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
rows.n: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= {selmuvdikca}, {muvdikca}; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}).  See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
rows.n: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b.  What is the locality on b that a hits?  Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$.  See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size $x_{2}$ (ka), made of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}).  See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops).  Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}).  See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). 'know/familiar with' - {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {cnino}, {na'e} {fange}. See also {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

rows.d: {cinmo} modal, 1st place                            emotionally felt by ...
{ckilu} modal, 1st place                            on the scale ...
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative                   >|<    |.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event   >|<.
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: partings/good-bye.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative      |  >< |.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm  |a|.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
{cusku} modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation)    as said by source ...; used for quotation.
letteral for c.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 1 (usually restricted).
digit/number: all except n; all but n; default 1.
binary mathematical operator: logarithm; [log/ln a to base b]; default base 10 or e.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
$x_1$ is of size/measurement $x_2$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$
$x_1$ is an axis/center curve/extended center (or, possibly metaphorically, focus 'point') of $x_2$ in sense $x_3$
rows.n: For figures of revolution, $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u srana lo {jbislanu}". For rotation (in which mass is actually moving around it), $x_3$ = "lo ka ce'u se carna". For a political axis, $x_3$ would be filled with a reference to political importance or alliance. This word should probably not be used for coordinate systems (coordinate axes), but some construct involving {manri} might be apt for such an idea if used. The axis is the center of all considerations being made and is extended.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a mathematical set, containing members $x_2$

$x_1$ is meta to/an example of $x_2$ that describes such an object/concept/notion/system/topic/etc., being meta in property/aspect $x_3$, and which has features $x_4$, governed by/considered in system/considerations/epistemology/theory $x_5$; $x_1$ is meta (a particular type of abstraction of $x_2$ so as to apply to itself in some sense); $x_1$ is an/a piece of/an example of $x_2$ that applies fractally thereto
rows.n: Does not (necessarily) mean "beyond", "after", "beside"; in some (rather pictoral) senses, these meanings may be necessary but not sufficient for being meta in this sense; thus, "metaphysics" should not be translated using this word. x1 is an object, notion, topic, system, etc. which applies to x2 but which is itself an example thereof; for example, the meanings of the words "metalinguistics" and "metadata" are meta in this sense. It is not necessarily directly self-referential, but could be fractally applicative. x1 is an X that is about (another) X; x1 is an abstraction of X so as to apply to X. x1 does not necessarily abstract [from] (in one sense), but is abstract to, x2. See also: {xulta} (generalized/weaker), {sucta}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
rows.n: (By analogy with {brivo}; syn. {cmevla}) In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevo} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevo. See also {vlaturge'a}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a logical 'if-else' (ternary conditional) statement saying that if $x_2$ is true, then $x_3$ is true (or performed), but otherwise/else (if $x_2$ is not true, then) $x_4$ is true (or performed).
rows.n: This word is like {kanxe} but for .{ifle}. See also: {sigda}.

rows.d: $x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$, showing same emotion $x_3$ about $x_4$
rows.n: A gismu for a very important concept that, for some reason, didn't find its way into the gimste. See {cinmo}, {dai}, {dunli}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a plum/member of subgenus Prunus of genus Prunus of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is functional / usable for function $x_2$

$x_1$ is a gesture/facial expression/body part motion/body language/expressive (nonverbal or nonvocal) feature/microexpression/stature/posture/sign/body signal [nonverbal expression made using only one's body parts and items on one's immediate person as extensions of the body in order to communicate; possibly nonlinguistic/extralinguistic] that conveys/expresses thought/emotion/command/idea $x_2$ (nu/si'o; possibly text and other types) made using body part/utensil/object/at locus $x_3$ in/by motion/action/means $x_4$
rows.n: Must be body-oriented; any other object involved is simply for the matter of convenience and acts as an extension of the body (and thus must be on the performer's immediate person at or near the locus of the gesture). Body language, posturing, and stature are usually considered to be nonlocalized (body-general), although they need not be (and technically are not in general). Must be externally visible and/or internally sensed. Any non-body-part utensil/item (including clothing) must function as an extension of the body in the gesture. Need not be conscious or performed by a person (note that agent/performer is not mentioned in this definition); can, but need not, be accompanied by vocalizations (not necessarily linguistic), but the gesture itself is not primarily noise-producing. Might include sign language words or cheremes, although a more explicit word for linguistically organized and ‚Äúfull‚Äù cheremes is preferred (and especially for the sign language as a whole). x1 is possibly best typed by {nu} and/or {si'o}. x4 might be best expressed as an event; for example, it could be "the event of the right hand touching the chest near the heart, with fist clenched" for a salute, whereas/wherein x3 would be merely the fist/hand (and the chest near the heart). Use "{cocygau}" resp. "{cocyzu'e}" for: "$x_1$ (agent resp. volitional entity) gestures; $x1$ agentively/actively makes gesture $x2$, communicating $x3$, performed with body part(s) $x4$ in motion $x5$"; this lujvo uses an unofficial cmarafsi. Proposed short rafsi: -coc-.

rows.d: $x_1$ appears
$x_1$ is a mythological/fantastic creature [mythical organism] of mythos/religion/story/culture $x_2$.
rows.n: Need not be an animal, nor even active, but must be alive/active/animate (includes ghosts, spirits, genies, etc.). The reference set of this word is a strict superset of the reference set of {crida}.  See also: {ranmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a lock/seal of/on/for sealing $x_{2}$ with/by locking mechanism $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Equivalent to "{stela}"; gismu similarity conflict with "{stero}" prohibited *"stera". In a dialect which prefers this word over "stela", the rafsi for this word would be "-ter-" and the rafsi for "{te}" would be "-tel-", thus normalizing and uniformizing the rafsi of the primary members of selma'o SE. See also: "{ckiku}".

rows.d: $x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to CLL (Lojbanic) grammatical standards in manner/aspect $x_2$, specific to version $x_3$ (contextless default: the most recent version that has been officially accepted by the Lojban language's governing body (presently, the BPFK))
$x_1$ is an arthropod; $x_1$ is a bug (broad sense)
rows.n: For a world in which {cinki} means "insect" or "hexapod". The source words for {cinki} mean "insect", so I prefer narrowing its meaning and adding a new word for "arthropod" based on more fitting source words. See also {lokra}, {jukni}, {sortu'e}

rows.d: $x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the norm/magnitude/size of concrete (and specific) mathematical object $x_2$ in norm space/according to metric (if relevant)/by definition/of type $x_3$
$x_1$ deduces/reasons by deduction/establishes by deduction that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ from general rule $x_4$

$x_1$ is aligned diagonally along/between nonadjacent vertices $x_2$ as in polytope $x_3$; $x_1$ is a diagonal line segment/linear manifold of lower dimension as viewed in frame of reference $x_3$; $x_1$ is crooked (one sense), skew (one sense, see notes), off-kilter (one sense), away from center/off-center, non-orthogonal/not perpendicular nor parallel, at an angle, perhaps non-vertical and non-horizontal, diagonal to $x_2$ in figure/coordinate system $x_3$.
rows.n: Not for use in: entries of tensors/matrices (confer: {daigno}), certain geometric meanings (such as with Cartesian products), etc.  Only for purely 'visual' geometric objects/figures/frames. The polytope in question need not actually be 'drawn'; an oriented frame of reference naturally 'projects' a polytopic sense onto all objects. x1 can be any linear manifold of lower dimension than the space in which it is embedded (defined by x3). The skewness is not relative to another linear manifold in some higher-dimensional space (the usual definition of "skew" in geometry) - it is simply a skewness (in a layperson sense) relative to points in a figure or axis in a coordinate system. Proposed by Gleki.

rows.d: $x_1$ belongs to conjugacy class $x_2$ in structure $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$

$x_1$ is a non-binary-gendered/hermaphrodite/intersexed (probably also can include: asexual, nongendered, indeterminately gendered) individual of species $x_2$ evidencing non-binary-gender trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is characterized by not following or fitting into some gender-binary.
$x_1$ wants to do $x_2$ (property of $x_1$)
rows.n: Based off of {djica} and {ka}.  See also {djica}

rows.d: $x1$ is a humidifier
$x1$=$g1$ dehumidifies $x2$=$c1$ by amount/excess $x3$
$x1$ is a dehumidifier
$n_1$=$z_1$=$x_1$ is sexually deviant/perverted in activity/state $n_2$=$x_2$ in property $z_3$=$n_3$=$x_3$ to person/by reference point $z_2$=$n_4$=$x_4$; $x1$ is sexually perverted
$ci_1$=$ct_1$ teaches audience $ct_2$ ideas/methods/lore $ct_3$ (du'u) about sexual activity/state $ci_2$=$ct_4$ by method $ct_5$ (event)
$m_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains oak wood/lumber from oak tree(s) of species/strain $m_2$=$c_2$.
$n_1$ is an acorn/oak nut from oak tree $n_2$=$c_1$ with shell $n_3$ and kernel $n_4$.
$c_1$=$t_1$ is a liliger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.
rows.n: The liliger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a ligress (Panthera leo √ó Panthera tigris).

rows.d: $c_1$=$t_1$ is is a liger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.
rows.n: A liger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a tigress (Panthera tigris).

rows.d: $x_1$ is August of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances lion dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ wearing lion costume $t_1$=$c_1$.
$p_1$ is a transsexual person.
$j_1$=$c_1$ courts/flirts with $j_1$, exhibiting sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ is sex slavery, the ownership of people for sexual purposes, according to law/custom/system $x_2$.
rows.n: Not necessarily by a formal system of slavery. Also connotes gendered slavery. Effectively synonymous with {glekemprezumpo'e}.

rows.d: $x_1$ eats/ingests/consumes insects/arthropods of species $x_2$.
rows.n: The eating of insects/arthropods is {cinkyzumcti}; arthropod 'meat' is '{cinkyre'u}'.

rows.d: $cit_1$=$s_1$ is a insectivorous plant of species $s_2$, eating insects/arthropods of species $cin_2$=$cit_2$.
$r_1$ is arthropod meat (body-parts regarded as edible) from species/breed $r_2$=$c_2$.
rows.n: Examples of {cinkyre'u} that are culturally important to humans include lobster-meat, chapulines, witchetty grubs, sago grubs and prawns. rows.d: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy)/fore/bow (nautical)/nose (skateboard etc), of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the ending point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
rows.n: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

$x_1$ (object/dimension) is shortest among set $x_2$ (set) in respective dimensions $x_3$ (default: the longest for each).
rows.n: Equivalent to "{toryrai}". Partially an .{u'ivla}, but with a little bit of philosophical underpinning: We should measure things by how much they have rather than how much they lack (good: how bright, how strong, how rich; bad: how dark, how weak, how poor) because 0 is the natural starting point and the quantity usually can be increased without upper bound. So, longness is a thing and shortness is a figment of our collective imagination, so to speak. So, "shortest" should really be "least long". Meanwhile, "{traji}" can accept either valence for extremeness, but defaults to the positive (id est: "most"), so we need to cajole it into the opposite ("least"). Thus, we get this long, gross word.

rows.d: $t_1$ is a brush/bushy vegetation of species/type $t_2$.
$x_1$=$c_1$=$t_1$ is a patch of land at $x_2$=$t_2$
$x_1$ (text) is an abbreviation/initialism/shortened text which represents/stands in for/means/expands to $x_2$ (text) in context/function $x_3$.
$xi_1$=$c_1$ is a pony of species/breed $xi_2$.
$z_1$ is a hut of/for $z_1$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ shrinks/decreases in property $c_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1$=$c_1$ to decrease in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$x_1$ is claustrophobic.
rows.n: Claustrophobia is a fear of small enclosed spaces. See also {noryraclyte'a}.

rows.d: $b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2$=$c_1$ of $x_3$=$c_2$ in circumstance $x_4$=$b_3$.
$x_1$ is anonymous to $x_2$; $x_1$ lacks a name to system/person $x_2$

$ci_1$ (mass) is a nomenclature/system of names interrelated by nomenclature rules $ci_2$ among names/terms $cm_1$=$ci_3$ (set (of quoted words)), used by $cm_3$ (person(s)) with systemic functions/properties $ci_4$ (ka).
$c_1$ (si'o) is a nominal scale of units [names and/or (meta-)categories and other qualitative classifications] for measuring/observing/determining $c_2$ (state).
$s_1$ identifies $s_2$=$c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$s_1$ is onomastics/onomatology of/about names $j_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2$=$c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2$=$c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_2$ with user-name $c_1$ on system/application $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
rows.n: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a cmevla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2$=$c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a set with many members; $x_1$ is a set with a great cardinality.
$cm_1$=$cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
rows.n: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

rows.d: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2$=$cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
rows.n: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

rows.d: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_1$ (collection/sequence) has $x_2$ (number) members
$s_1$=$c_1$ is logged into system/application $s_2$=$c_2$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_1$ as a member of $c_2$, registration preserved in medium $x_3$=$v_4$.
$x_1$ is an eligible/potential voter in issue (list of options) $x_2$, (with $x_1$) being a voting member of group $x_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_1$ entertains axiomatic belief that $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$=$z2$=$j_1$ is an infrastructure built by $x_2$=$z$=$1$ out of $x_3$=$z_3$ for $x_4$=$j_2$
$x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is an axiom/doctrine/creed/postulate about subject $x_2$, foundational to system $x_3$
rows.n: $x_1$ = {krici}$_2$ = {jicmu}$_1$, $x_2$ = {krici}$_3$, $x_3$ = {jicmu}$_2$. The system may be religious, philosophical, scientific, or mathematical. Refers to any proposition assumed as true without being proved within the system itself. See {sruma}

rows.d: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2$=$c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.

$x_1$ (li) is the (signed) difference between the average of all elements/data of $x_2$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list) and single number $x_3$ (li; default: infimum of $x_2$ under ordering $x_6$ if such is finite), using averaging function $x_4$ (default: arithmetic average), weights $x_5$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list with the same cardinality/length as $x_2$; default: according to notes), and inherited ordering $x_6$ (default: standard ordering on the set of reals).
rows.n: Default for $x_5$ is the same as the default for the weights of the given averaging function $x_4$, which for the arithmetic mean of a finite set is the ordered set of $|x_2|$ terms with each term equal identically to $1/|x_2|$, where "| |" represents the cardinality of its input (circumfixed). $x_6$ is defined on a superset of $x_2$ united with the singleton of $x_3$. The default for $x_6$ is {mrenspoi}. For example: If $x_2 = (1, 7)$ and all of the defaults hold, then $x_1 = avg(1,7) - min(1,7) = 4 - 1 = 3$; when all defaults hold and $x_2$ is a bounded set, $x_1$ is the difference between the arithmetic average of (or average of the uniform distribution on) $x_2$ and the infimum of $x_2$. See also: "{sigma}".

rows.d: $x_1$ makes $x_2$ vary in property $x_3$ in amount $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$
$x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_1$ feels $x_2$ (ka) about $x_3$ feeling $x_4$ (ka) about $x_5$
$co_1$=$ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3$=$c_2$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ shows emotion $j_2$=$c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$x_1$ emotionally believes $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
rows.n: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {krici}, {cnisenpi}

rows.d: $x_1$=$c_1$=$m_1$ feels flattered about $x_2$=$c_3$=$m_2$.
$v_1$ is an interjection/attitudinal meaning $v_2$=$c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$ is a therapist treating $x_2$=$m_2$=$c_1$ for $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ with treatment $x_4$=$m_4$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_3$ is romantic to $x_2$=$m_2$; $x_1$ is beautiful to $x_2$ because it follows or is based on some emotional ideal that may not actually reflect reality.
rows.n: Not "romantic" in the sense of "pertaining to intimate love" (={cinpamra'a}); rather, "romantic" in the sense of viewing emotions as a higher and more important quality with extraordinary properties. See also {cinmo}, {melbi}.

rows.d: $x_1$ (event/state) feels (emotionally) good / pleasant / nice to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a question about $x_3$=$c_2$=$p_4$‚Äôs emotion, asked by $x_2$=$p_3$ to $x_3$=$c_3$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2$=$c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3$=$c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4$=$c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5$=$r_3$; $x_1$=$r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ emotionally disbelieves $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
rows.n: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {senpi}, {cnikri}

rows.d: $x_1$=$ci_1$=$cu_1$ expresses emotion $x_2$=$ci_2$=$cu_2$/emotionally expresses $x_2$ for audience $x_3$=$cu_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$=$cu_4$.
$t_1$=$c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2$=$c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$x_1$ is therapy, given to patient $x_2$ for ailment $x_3$ by therapist $x_4$
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2$=$c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
$c_1$=$n_1$ is deep inside $n_2$ by standard $c_4$
rows.n: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {condi},{nenri}

rows.d: $x_1$=$p_1$ is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature $x_2$=$c_1$=$t_1$ from $x_3$=$p_2$ to $x_4$=$p_3$
rows.n: "Potential" in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

rows.d: $x_1$=$cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
rows.n: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

rows.d: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.

rows.n: From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

rows.d: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a deep/rumbling sound produced by $s_2$=$c_2$ from point of reference $c_3$.
rows.n: $c_3$ could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

rows.d: $x_2$ (entity) takes action $x_3$ (property of $x_2$) in order to $x_4$ (clause)
rows.n: Showcase of VSO-like style in Lojban. $x_1$ is undefined. See also {zuktela}, {zukte}, {rafybri}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a thingamajig / thing which the speaker can't put a predicate upon
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ be in some unspecified relation with $x_3$; $x_1$ assigns / pairs up $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$c_1$=$b_1$ is a deep-sea submarine for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$x_1$ quits/stops/aborts waiting/pausing for/until $x_2$ at state $x_3$ and starts/continues with $x_4$ (activity/process).
rows.n: The pause waiting is not completed. See {co'u}, {denpa}.

rows.d: $d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
